t: Proverbs 15
A*p soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
The*p tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
The*p eyes of the Lord*s are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
A*p wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
A*p fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
In*p the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
The*p lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
The*p sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord:*s but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
The*p way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord:*s but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
Correction*p is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.
Hell*p and destruction are before the Lord:*s how much more then the hearts of the children of men?
A*p scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
A*p merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
The*p heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
All*p the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.
Better*p is little with the fear of the Lord*s than great treasure and trouble therewith.
Better*p is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
A*p wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
The*p way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
A*p wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
Folly*p is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
Without*p counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
A*p man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!
The*p way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.
The*p Lord*s will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.
The*p thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord:*s but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
He*p that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
The*p heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
The*p Lord*s is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
The*p light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.
The*p ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
He*p that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
